variant.question: After declaring a state of urgency to ATC,on what frequency must the pilot normally maintain listening watch?

options.text: Guard frequency.
The frequency in use at the time, unless advised by the air traffic controller.
Company frequency.
The international distress frequency.

variant.question: Traffic on your current frequency has declared a state of urgency. After several attempts you notice the controller does not seem to be receiving the urgency message. What must you do?

options.text: Confirm receipt of the urgency call with other stations on frequency.
Relay the message on the international guard frequency.
Maintain radio silence until ATC has acknowledged the call.
Reply to the urgency message, advise the ATS unit, and if necessary exercise control of communications.

variant.question: You have been contracted by the government to carry a cargo consisting solely of medical supplies and personnel to a conflict area. To ensure priority, what message should you pass when in contact with an ATS unit?

options.text: You are only entitled to priority if you are a registered ambulance aircraft, and as such it is sufficient to state the appropriate call sign.
After the prefix PAN PAN three times, state your call sign, the fact you are carrying medical supplies and personnel, the pilot\`s intentions, current position, and heading.
After your call sign, current position, level, heading, frequencies guarded and secondary surveillance radar modes and codes, close the transmission with the words “PAN MEDICAL”.
After the prefix PAN PAN three times, followed by the word “MEDICAL”, state your call sign, your position, type, intended route, estimated time of arrival at destination, and current altitude.

variant.question: An aircraft receives a TCAS RA and executes the manoeuvre, but before the pilots can transmit to ATC, another traffic reports an urgency. What should they do?

options.text: Remain at the new altitude until the urgent transmission has ended, then advise ATC and request a new FL.
Return to the previous altitude and wait until the urgency has ended, then report TCAS RA to ATC when time allows.
Remain at the new altitude and fly a holding pattern until the urgent transmission has ended, then advise ATC and request a new FL.
Return to the previous flight level and interrupt the urgency transmission to report the TCAS advisory.

variant.question: On the pilot’s active VHF frequency, another traffic has declared a state of urgency. Urgency is defined as a condition..

options.text: concerning the illegal seizure of an aircraft in transit and forcing it to go to a different destination, which requires immediate assistance.
concerning the immediate safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, which requires immediate assistance.
concerning the safety of an aircraft or other vehicle, or of some person on board or within sight, but which does not require immediate assistance.
of being in serious and/or imminent danger and of requiring immediate assistance.

variant.question: You have declared an emergency, and landed. ATC then transfers you to another frequency. What is the primary reason for such frequency transfer?

options.text: To allow for direct contact between the emergency aircraft and rescue and firefighting services on a discrete frequency.
The support from ATC for the emergency traffic ends once the emergency aircraft has landed.
To ensure confidentiality, a special frequency is used that cannot be monitored by 'Live ATC' services or aviation band scanners.
ATC removes the emergency aircraft from the Tower frequency in order to restore the regular flow of traffic.

variant.question: A pilot in flight hears an urgency message but does not hear any station replying. What action must the pilot take?

options.text: Return to the previous frequency to avoid interfering with urgency communications.
Squawk 7700 and re-transmit all urgency messages received on the emergency frequency 121.5 MHz.
Acknowledge the urgency message.
Stop transmitting on the frequency until the Air Traffic Services provide replies.

variant.question: You receive an urgency message on the international distress frequency, but no other station answers. You are required, amongst other actions, to..

options.text: retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the frequency with which you are in communication with ATC, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.

retransmit the urgency message as it was originally transmitted on the international distress frequency using your own call sign, but do not communicate directly with the aircraft that made the original transmission.
acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, then take immediate action to make all necessary information available to the appropriate Air Traffic Service unit.
acknowledge the message to the aircraft in the state of urgency, and await for instructions from the pilot of the calling aircraft.
